title: Red Lobster Shrimp Scampi
description: This easy Red Lobster Shrimp Scampi delivers restaurant-quality flavor right at home. Perfect for both special occasions and quick weeknight dinners when you want something impressive without the fuss.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the shrimp in a single layer and cook for about two minutes on each side until they turn pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp and set aside, keeping them warm.
In the same skillet, add the minced garlic. Cook the garlic just 30 seconds until fragrant being careful not to burn it. If the pan feels dry, add a splash more olive oil.
Pour in the white wine and fresh lime juice. Bring the mixture to a gentle boil and let it reduce until the liquid has halved in volume.
Sprinkle in the Italian seasoning and red pepper flakes. Let the sauce simmer for a couple of minutes so the herbs and spice release their aromas and meld with the wine reduction.
Turn the heat down to low. When the sauce stops bubbling, add the butter in pieces. Allow it to melt slowly while stirring so it emulsifies into a smooth, silky sauce.

Return the shrimp along with any juices back to the skillet. Stir in the fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese. Warm everything together for a minute until heated through and the cheese partly melts. Serve immediately while hot.
tips: Always dry your shrimp thoroughly with paper towels before cooking so you get that perfect sear instead of steaming. Adding the butter off the heat or low temperature helps the sauce stay silky without breaking. If your wine is very acidic, balance with a teaspoon of sugar or a touch more butter.

structured_content.content: This dish features shrimp gently cooked in olive oil and garlic, then simmered in a white wine and lime reduction. Italian seasoning and red pepper flakes add aromatic warmth. Butter finishes the sauce, enriching the flavors, while Parmesan and fresh parsley provide a savory, fresh finish. Perfect for both special occasions and casual dinners, it’s full of zest and satisfying textures.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Uses simple ingredients you probably already have in your kitchen
  • Ready in about 30 minutes so you can enjoy dinner without a long wait
  • Bright and flavorful with garlic, fresh lime, and a touch of spice
  • Buttery and rich, balanced perfectly with fresh parsley and Parmesan cheese

structured_content.content: I first tried this recipe when craving that classic Red Lobster taste, and now it’s a favorite for gatherings and date nights alike. Everyone always asks for seconds and it feels fancy without complicated cooking.

• Main ingredient: One pound of shrimp peeled and deveined: fresh or frozen works fine, just pat dry well for best searing
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Four garlic cloves minced: fresh garlic gives a fragrant base
  • Supporting ingredients: One and a half cups dry white wine: choose something you enjoy drinking because it really impacts the sauce
  • Equipment needed: Skillet

Preparation:
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook shrimp for 2 minutes per side until opaque. Remove shrimp and keep warm.
Cooking/Baking Process:
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds, stirring to deglaze the pan. Add additional olive oil if necessary.
Finishing Touches:
Return shrimp and accumulated juices to the skillet. Add chopped parsley and Parmesan cheese. Heat gently until warmed through. Serve immediately.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• This dish is high in protein and low in carbohydrates making it both satisfying and light
  • It freezes well if you want to prep ahead but best enjoyed fresh for that buttery garlic sauce
  • Shrimp cooks very quickly, so do not overcook or they will become rubbery
  • I love how the fresh lime juice perfectly cuts through the richness of butter bringing brightness to the whole recipe.

structured_content.content: One cherished family moment is making this for a dinner party where everyone raved about how restaurant-like it tasted, all from just a handful of quality ingredients.

Store the scampi in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two days. When reheating, warm gently on the stove with a splash of white wine or water to bring back the sauce’s texture without drying out the shrimp. Avoid microwave reheating if possible to keep shrimp tender.

Serve Red Lobster Shrimp Scampi over cooked linguine or angel hair pasta to soak up the sauce perfectly. It pairs beautifully with steamed green beans, a crisp arugula salad with lemon, or crusty bread to mop up every last drop.

If you do not have white wine, a dry vermouth or low sodium chicken broth with a teaspoon of lemon juice can work just as well in the reduction. For the Italian seasoning, dried oregano and basil can substitute individually. Parsley can be replaced with fresh basil or chives for a different herbal note.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Always dry your shrimp thoroughly with paper towels before cooking so you get that perfect sear instead of steaming
  • I learned the hard way that skipping toasting the garlic even slightly can lead to bitterness
  • Adding the butter off the heat or low temperature helps the sauce stay silky without breaking
  • If your wine is very acidic, balance with a teaspoon of sugar or a touch more butter

structured_content.content: This recipe is perfect for a quick yet impressive seafood dinner that feels upscale without complexity.
